author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: ْهَدُ جَوارِحِيْ بِوَحْدانِيَّتِكَ وَشَعَراتِي بِسَلْطَنَتِكَ وَاقْتِدارِكَ وَقُمْتُ لَدى بابِ فَضْلِكَ بِالكَيْنُونَةِ المَعْدُومَةِ وَالذَّاتِيَّةِ المَفْقُودَةِ مُتَشَبِّثًا بِذَيْلِ كَرَمِكَ وَناظِرًا
translation: The limbs of my body testify to Thy unity, and the hair of my head declareth the power of Thy sovereignty and might. I have stood at the door of Thy grace with utter self-effacement and complete abnegation, and clung to the hem of Thy bounty, and fixed mine eyes upon the horizon of Thy gifts.
